msIdentifier.repository: National Archives and Records Administration, Seattle Branch, Washington

div1.p: United States District Court, Western District of Washington, Northern Division.
In the matter of the Application of Ching Hing for a Writ of Habeas Corpus
No. Cross-Interrogatories to be propounded to Louis F. Post, Assistant Secretary of the Department of Labor, Washington, D. C.

1. Is it not a fact that when the Acting Secretary goes over the facts or comes to a decision in an appeal case when either youself or the Secretary of Labor is present, that either you or the Secretary of Labor is notified of the decision and have sufficiently accurate knowlegde of the subject of appeal to verify the decision of the Acting Secretary or to have such a decision modified if you think it is wrong?
2. Is it not a fact that when J. B. Densmore reviews a decision of this character, on appeal, that either you or the Secretary of Labor checks over his ruling and makes it your own?
3. Is it not a fact that in the above entitled action Secretary J. B. Densmore performed the labor or reviewing the above decision, either in the absence of the Secretary of Labor, or yourself?

4. If the Secretary of Labor or yourself was present at the time that J. B. Densmore decided the appeal in the above entitled action, is it not a fact that either you or the Secretary of Labor checked his work, verified the same and made his decision yours?

5. Is it not a fact that in all cases when J. B. Densmore, the Acting Secretary, renders a decision on the appeal of any case of the same character as this one during the time of the presence of yourself or the Secretary of Labor, either you or the Secretary of Labor checks and verifies the work of said Acting Secretary and makes it your decision?
